channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hurricane Debby remnants leave thousands of businesses and homes without power in the Northeast
item.description: After hitting Florida as a hurricane Aug. 5, the storm spent nearly a week unleashing tornadoes and flooding, damaging homes and taking lives along the East Coast.

item.title: DirecTV is pushing its pay TV bundle — without a satellite dish
item.description: DirecTV's latest ad campaign emphasizes the company's streaming options as consumers shift away from satellite dishes -- and the traditional pay TV bundle.

item.title: U.S. stocks face a bumpy road to recovery with inflation, earnings updates ahead
Americans are refusing to keep paying high prices and that may be killing the U.S. inflation spike
item.description: Some of America's largest companies, from Amazon to Disney to Yum Brands, say customers are seeking cheaper alternative products, searching for bargains or just avoiding items they deem too expensive.

item.title: Monday's analyst calls: Nvidia earnings preview, Robinhood to rally nearly 30%
item.description: A chipmaker and an online brokerage were among the stocks being talked about by analysts to start the week.

item.title: Where stocks may be headed after a wild week, according to the options market
Paris Olympic dream struck a chord across France. Now Macron faces a fraught return to reality
item.description: While the Games have lifted what was a morose mood in France, it is far from certain this will give a new impulse to the remaining three years of the unpopular president's mandate.

item.title: Adani Group shares shed billions after Hindenburg allegations against regulator
item.description: The group's flagship firm Adani Enterprises slipped as much as 5% in early morning deals, before paring some of its losses.

item.title: What Tim Walz’s progressive tax record says about Kamala Harris’s tax plans
Foreign investors pulled a record $15 billion out of China last quarter
item.description: The slowdown in the economy and rising geopolitical tensions has led some companies to reduce their exposure.

item.title: White House launches broad new regulatory effort, as Harris prepares to unveil economic plan
item.description: The "Time is Money" initiative is being launched as Vice President Kamala Harris prepares to unveil her presidential campaign's first economic policy plans.

item.title: Stock market suffers another August scare. Here are the lessons for investors.
American tourists are flocking to boardwalks and piers to stick to their summer budgets
item.description: While the affluent are spending freely, lower-income vacationers are sticking to carefully planned-out budgets.

item.title: U.S. sends more forces to the Middle East in anticipation of Iranian attack on Israel
item.description: The Pentagon ordered a guided missile submarine to the region, as well as a carrier strike group equipped with F-35C fighter jets.

item.title: Hard or soft landing? How ‘recession pop’ may hold clues about the economy.
